item.title: Hello world!
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Welcome to WordPress. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start writing!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Hi, this is a comment. To get started with moderating, editing, and deleting comments, please visit the Comments screen in the dashboard. Commenter avatars come from Gravatar.

item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:

Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)

...or something like this:

The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.

As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Who we are

Suggested text: Our website address is: http://localhost/wordpress.

Comments

Suggested text: When visitors leave comments on the site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitor’s IP address and browser user agent string to help spam detection.

An anonymized string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it. The Gravatar service privacy policy is available here: https://automattic.com/privacy/. After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.

Media

Suggested text: If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included. Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.

Cookies

Suggested text: If you leave a comment on our site you may opt-in to saving your name, email address and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when you leave another comment. These cookies will last for one year.

If you visit our login page, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.

When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two days, and screen options cookies last for a year. If you select "Remember Me", your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.

If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after 1 day.

Embedded content from other websites

Suggested text: Articles on this site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.

These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.

Who we share your data with

Suggested text: If you request a password reset, your IP address will be included in the reset email.

How long we retain your data

Suggested text: If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely. This is so we can recognize and approve any follow-up comments automatically instead of holding them in a moderation queue.

For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.

What rights you have over your data

Suggested text: If you have an account on this site, or have left comments, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you, including any data you have provided to us. You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.

Where your data is sent

Suggested text: Visitor comments may be checked through an automated spam detection service.

item.title: Prod
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Embracing DevOps: The Path to Agile and Efficient Software Delivery

In today's fast-paced software industry, the pressure to deliver high-quality software quickly and efficiently is paramount. DevOps, a compound of "development" and "operations," is not just a methodology but a culture that helps bridge the gap between developers and IT operations, ensuring faster and more effective software delivery. The Essence of DevOps At its core, DevOps is about improving collaboration across all stakeholders in the software development process, including developers, QA, IT staff, and management. It integrates and automates the processes b etween software development and IT teams, allowing them to build, test, and release software more rapidly and reliably.   git clone https://github.com/Aj7Ay/k8s-mario.git Key Benefits  
  1. Speed: DevOps accelerates the pace of software development by fostering a culture of continuous integration and continuous delivery. This speed enables organizations to better serve their customers and compete more effectively in the market.
  2. Reliability: DevOps practices like continuous integration and automated testing mean that the software can be reliably released at any time. It helps in quickly identifying and rectifying defects, improving service stability and overall quality.
  3. Improved Collaboration: By promoting a culture that enhances communication and collaboration, DevOps breaks down the silos between teams. This integration helps in aligning goals and improving efficiency during the production cycles.
  4. Increased Efficiency: Automation and consistency help to make the operational processes more predictable, significantly reducing the risk of errors and inefficiency in production environments.
  5. Enhanced Security: DevOps encourages the integration of security aspects early in the development cycle, improving the compliance with security regulations and making the applications less vulnerable to attacks.
Implementing DevOps To implement DevOps, organizations need to adopt a range of tools that support aspects like continuous integration, continuous delivery, infrastructure as code, and monitoring and logging. Tools such as Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes, and Ansible play a critical role in automating and streamlining the various phases of the software development lifecycle. Moreover, a shift to DevOps demands a change in mindset and culture. It requires teams to be more agile, flexible, and open to embracing new tools and practices. Continuous learning and improvement are the keys to maintaining an effective DevOps environment. Conclusion DevOps is not just a buzzword but a necessary shift in the IT culture, aimed at improving collaboration, efficiency, and the overall quality of software. By adopting DevOps practices, companies are not only enhancing their IT operations but are also ensuring that they can thrive in an environment of continuous change. For businesses looking to stay competitive, DevOps is no longer optional but a critical component of their operational strategy.

item.title: Gaurav Projects
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Running a Node.js application using PM2 (Process Manager 2) is a popular way to manage and keep Node.js applications online 24/7. PM2 is a production process manager for Node.js applications that provides features like load balancing, logging, monitoring, and clustering, simplifying the way you manage your applications. Heres a step-by-step guide on how to use PM2 to run your Node.js application:

Step 1: Install Node.js

First, ensure Node.js is installed on your system. You can check this by running:
bash
node -v
If Node.js is not installed, you can download and install it from Node.js official website.

Step 2: Install PM2

Install PM2 globally using npm (Node Package Manager) so you can use it from anywhere in your system:
bash
npm install pm2 -g

Step 3: Start Your Application

Navigate to your project directory where your Node.js application is located (the folder where your main file, like app.js or server.js, is located). Start your application with PM2 by using:
bash
pm2 start app.js
Replace app.js with the entry file of your application. PM2 will now keep your application running in the background.

Step 4: Manage Your Application

PM2 provides several commands to manage your application:
  • List all running processes: pm2 list
  • Monitor processes: pm2 monit
  • Stop an application: pm2 stop app_name_or_id
  • Restart an application: pm2 restart app_name_or_id
  • Delete an application from PM2's registry: pm2 delete app_name_or_id
Where app_name_or_id is the name or id of your application as listed in pm2 list.

Step 5: Logs

You can check the logs for your application using:
bash
pm2 logs
This command displays all logs from all applications managed by PM2. To view logs of a specific application, use:
bash
pm2 logs app_name_or_id

Step 6: Configure to Auto-start on Reboot

To ensure your application starts automatically after a reboot, you can use PM2's startup script generator:
bash
pm2 startup
This command will generate a startup script for your system's init system. Execute the command it suggests afterward to set up PM2 to start on boot.

Step 7: Save Your Process List

To save the current list of processes you have running with PM2 (so they can be reloaded on restart of PM2), use the following command:
bash
pm2 save

Conclusion

PM2 is a powerful tool for managing Node.js applications. By leveraging PM2, you can ensure that your Node.js appl

item.title: Docker
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
# Use an official Ruby runtime as a parent image FROM ruby:2.7-slim
# Set the working directory WORKDIR /usr/src/app
# Install Asciidoctor and any other dependencies RUN apt-get update && \ apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends \ build-essential \ git \ && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/* \ && gem install asciidoctor asciidoctor-pdf asciidoctor-diagram
# Copy the local code to the container's workspace COPY . .
# Command to run when starting the container CMD ["asciidoctor", "-r", "asciidoctor-pdf", "-r", "asciidoctor-diagram", "-b", "pdf", "your-document.adoc"]
